project: The Grid Nexus - Cursor AI Implementation Blueprint

features.name: Nexus Risk-to-Reward Gaming Index
features.goal: Integrate a 'Privacy & Security' rating system into gaming review layouts.

implementation_steps.prompt: @Codebase create a Prisma schema for a SecurityRating model. It should include fields for dataEncryption (boolean), accountMFA (boolean), dataSharingPolicy (enum), and an aggregate NexusSecurityScore (0-100).
Generate a React component GameSecurityCard.tsx that displays a radar chart comparing a game's 'Fun Factor' vs its 'Security Risk'. Use the @Nexus-Standard for styling.
Implement logic to calculate NexusSecurityScore based on: E (Encryption), M (MFA status), and P (Privacy policy transparency).

features.name: Interactive AI-Pulse Roadmap
features.goal: Develop a live-updating timeline for AI and Machine Learning tech trends.

implementation_steps.prompt: Create a vertical interactive timeline component using Framer Motion. It should fetch data from our /api/ai-updates and allow users to filter by 'Productivity', 'Creative', or 'Gaming AI'.
Add a 'Hype vs. Utility' toggle. When 'Hype' is selected, dim the items that are just marketing fluff. When 'Utility' is selected, highlight items with confirmed machine learning benchmarks.
Verify the animations and responsiveness on mobile viewports.

features.name: The Breach Simulation
features.goal: Create a text-based, interactive cybersecurity training module.

implementation_steps.prompt: Create a state machine for a 'Data Breach Simulation'. Start at 'Phishing Email Received'. Options: 'Click Link', 'Report to IT', 'Delete'. Each choice should branch to a different security outcome.
Using @Codebase, create a 'Nexus XP' system. Users gain points for making secure choices in the simulation. Save progress to local storage.
Design the UI to look like a Terminal interface (retro-green text on black). Add a progress bar that drains if the 'Breach Level' gets too high.

features.name: Unified Cross-Section Reports
features.goal: Link Tech, Security, and Gaming content through a unified dynamic template.

implementation_steps.prompt: Build a Next.js dynamic route template [slug]/nexus-intersection. This page must pull 1 Tech article, 1 Security alert, and 1 Gaming guide and find a common keyword to link them in a 'Nexus Summary' at the top.
@web search for the latest link between RTX 50-series and AI-driven password cracking. Generate a summary component that bridges these two topics for this template.

features.name: User-Facing Threat Score Extension
features.goal: Launch a Chrome Extension providing real-time domain threat scores.

implementation_steps.prompt: Generate a manifest.v3 Chrome Extension. It needs a content_script.js that reads the current URL and a popup.html that displays the TheGridNexus 'Threat Score' for that domain.
Write a fetch function that sends the current domain to https://thegridnexus.com/api/threat-score and updates the popup icon to Green (Safe), Yellow (Caution), or Red (High Risk).
Run a security audit on this extension code. Ensure the API key is not exposed and the permissions are minimal according to Chrome Web Store standards.
